snippet: A ROSE by any other name may smell as sweet. And so may a grapevine. But don't tell that to Chuck Wagner Jr.    Mr. Wagner is the president and winemaker at Caymus Vineyards in the Napa Valley in California. Someone sold him a bunch of roussanne v...
lead_paragraph: A ROSE by any other name may smell as sweet. And so may a grapevine. But don't tell that to Chuck Wagner Jr. Mr. Wagner is the president and winemaker at Caymus Vineyards in the Napa Valley in California. Someone sold him a bunch of roussanne vines a few years ago, and he was looking forward to making $75-a-bottle wines from them. Until someone else told him they were not roussanne at all but viognier. Now, Mr. Wagner is suing the seller for $7 million.
abstract: Lawsuits are filed in California over viognier vines that were falsely sold as roussanne vines; drawing (M)

headline.main: A Tangle of Vines and Lawsuits
